ElementDescription: The NDAR Global Unique Identifier (GUID) for research subject
Subject ID how it's defined in lab/project
Date on which the interview/genetic test/sampling/imaging/biospecimen was completed. MM/DD/YYYY
Age in months at the time of the interview/test/sampling/imaging.
Notes: Age is rounded to chronological month. If the research participant is 15-days-old at time of interview, the appropriate value would be 0 months. If the participant is 16-days-old, the value would be 1 month.

ElementDescription: Sex of subject at birth
Notes: M = Male; F = Female; O=Other; NR = Not reported

ElementDescription: Session serial number
Block serial number
Serial number of the skin site used for thermal pain with thermodes
Trial serial number (within each block and session for each participant)
Name of task.
The type of the presented cue
A string representing the option presented in the left side of the screen
A string representing the option presented in the right side of the screen
A string representing the outcome (of the two options- left and right)
Affective rating of the outcome
Response time of the affective rating
Subjective rating of pain intensity
Response time of pain rating
Rating of the expected intensity of pain stimuli following the presented cue
Response time of pain expectation rating
Rating of the expected heat related to the presented cue
Response time of heat expectation rating
Rating of the confidence in the reported expectation
Response time of pain expectation confidence rating
The peak temperature of the thermal pain stimulus
The level of heat of the presented thermometer
The monetary outcome (plus for gains and minus for losses), if any
